sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
Suppose that a person of height 0.5 meters is walking away from the base of a lamp post at a speed of 1.1 m/sec. If the lamp is 5.5 meters above the ground, find the length of her shadow after 4 seconds.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "Suppose that IJ be the lamp post and KL be the person. Then JL becomes the distance covered by the person in 4 seconds. 

tikzpicture{}
"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow JL = \input[s2v1]{} \times 4 =\input[s2v2]{} 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "$$\text{
Let $LM = x$ meters be the length of the shadow of the person after 4 seconds. 

Now, observe triangles IJM and KLM}$$ 
\[
	\angle I\input[s3v1]{}J = \angle KML 
\]
\[
	\angle IJM = \angle K\input[s3v2]{}M 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, by angle angle similarity, we can write
\[
	\Delta IJM \sim \Delta KLM 
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{IJ }{KL } = \frac{JM }{LM }
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{\input[s6v1]{} }{0.5 } = \frac{\input[s6v2]{} + x }{x}
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 11.0 x = 4.4 + x
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 10.0 x = 4.4 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow x = \input[s6v3]{} m
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, this is the length of the person's shadow after 4 seconds.
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [1.1, 4.4], "text": "$$\text{The distance covered by the person in 4 seconds by multiplying the speed of the person with the time he traveled would be $JL = 1.1 \times 4 = 4.4$}$$"}, {"data": ["M", "L"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle IMJ = \angle KML $, since both angles are same, and $\angle IJM = \angle KLM $, since both are right angles.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{As ratios of corresponding sides of similar triangles is proportional, therefore, $\frac{IJ }{KL } = \frac{JM }{LM }$}$$"}, {"data": [5.5, 4.4, 0.44], "text": "$$\text{Putting the values and accordingly solving for it we get $x = 0.44 $m.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
